results.content:
Ce cours n'est malheureusement plus à jour, et il est très difficile de le suivre aujourd'hui. 
How to GraphQL est une meilleure alternative (gratuite en plus). 
A suivre si l'auteur publie une mise à jour.

results.content: I didn't appreciate this course. Instructor speaking is not motivating and not easy to understand in my opinion. Sometimes he tried to give explanations, but not so much. Most of the time just follow the instructor showing what code to modify.  I didn't see any exercices or challenges. Maybe I missed it because I stop after several chapters.

results.content: Video is not clear for the first few seconds of the session. for VS code setup the session is not clear for the entire time. so far the experience is horrible.

results.content:
The instructor is explaining things to himself.  Way too often he enters into an internal dialogue that explains things from his understanding and not from the student's often making reference to things he has not explained.

Does he really think that if we knew how to read the source-code of Apollo Provider we would be taking this course?

Having a lot of knowledge doesn't make an instructor, neither does writing code as you debug your own mistakes; explaining things from the context of the learner is what a good instructor does. I wasted hours listening to this and haven't learned anything.

response.content: Thanks Juan for giving me review. What is the one thing I have to improve in the next course? Could you explain this line "explaining things from the context of the learner is what a good instructor does"?
response.content_html: Thanks Juan for giving me review. What is the one thing I have to improve in the next course? Could you explain this line "explaining things from the context of the learner is what a good instructor does"?
